function.description: Base-64 decode the string content, and store it in the file fileName. Commonly used to decode binary data transferred over a text channel (such as attachments in e-mails).

examples.example:
Read the textfile note.xml and return: "PG5vdGU+DQo8dG8+VG92ZTwvdG8+DQo8ZnJvbT5KYW5pPC9mcm9tPg0KPGhlYWRpbmc+UmVtaW5kZXI8L2hlYWRpbmc+DQo8Ym9keT5Eb24ndCBmb3JnZXQgbWUgdGhpcyB3ZWVrZW5kITwvYm9keT4NCjwvbm90ZT4=" Assuming note.xml contains the following text:
<note> <to>Tove</to> <from>Jani</from> <heading>Reminder</heading> <body>Don't forget me this weekend!</body> </note>
